desc.value: Change the generation algorithm of the map.
A smaller map for a tenser game around the northern hemisphere where every space is heavily contested.
The regular-sized map for a well-balanced game around the northern hemisphere.
A larger map for a more relaxed game around the northern hemisphere where you are free to expand.
The standard map for a duel in the northern hemisphere.
A large, sparsely-populated map with many deep deserts, for a strong emphasis on mobility.
A large, densely-populated map for longer games with many heavy defensive positions.
A medium map with many small deep desert and mountains for increased strategic expansion.
A large ridge crossing the desert, with two players at each extremity. Perfect for team matches.
A large valley with two players on each side. Perfect for team matches.
A small crack between two mountain ranges. Ideal for a cramped duel with strong defensive positions.
Let the dice choose a map type for you. Be ready for anything!
Change the aggressiveness of [Sandworm]s, that will attack units and harvesters in the sand.
Completely remove [Sandworm]s from Arrakis.
[Sandworm]s will take twice as long to wake up from unit and harvester activity.
[Sandworm]s will attack at the regular speed.
[Sandworm]s will take half as long to wake up from unit and harvester activity.
Change the frequency of [Sandstorm] apparition. [Sandstorm]s will roam the map, blocking some key defensive buildings, and harming flying units.
Completely remove [Sandstorm]s from Arrakis.
[Sandstorm]s will appear later, less often, and last a shorter amount of time.
[Sandstorm]s will appear at the regular rate.
[Sandstorm] will appear more often and last longer.
Change the frequency and strength of raids and neutral militia.
Raids will happen less often. Neutral units will be at a severe disadvantage in any engagement.
Raids will happen at the regular rate. Neutral units will start about as strong as the player's units, and slowly grow stronger over time.
Raids will happen more often. Neutral units will start stronger and grow even stronger over time.
Change the amount of Spice due, every 25 days, for contracts.
All Spice contracts will be 30% less expensive.
Spice contracts will cost the normal amount of Spice.
All Spice contracts will be 50% more expensive.
Change the duration of Landsraad's phases and similar events.
Enable/Disable victory conditions.
Eliminate every opponent to win.
Reach ::value(Game_Victory_HegemonyScore):: [Hegemony] to win.
Hold the [Charter] [DuneGovernor] for ::value(Game_Victory_GovernorDuration):: days to win.
Hold ::percent_value(Game_Victory_Economy_ChoamShare):: of [CHOAMShare]s to win.
Opponents can be eliminated through assassination missions.
Change how challenging you want your opponents to be.
The Easy AI has no military or economic advantage. It will develop slower and be gentle with the player. It's the perfect difficulty for discovering the game at your own pace.
The Medium AI has no military or economic advantage. It can develop at a normal rate, and will treat the player as any other faction.
The Hard AI has small bonuses to most of its productions and military units, to give it an edge. It will also see the player as more threatening than other factions, and act in consequence.
The Insane AI has a boosted economy and its military units are stronger. It will play for the win and try to crush the player at any opportunity.
Change how many AIs you want to face.
Choose up to three factions, as opponents to be controlled by the computer.
Accelerate the early game, mostly through resource gifts. Not recommended for beginners.
Change the way time speed is controlled during the game.
The game goes at regular speed and cannot be changed. Recommended for beginners.
The game goes 20% faster and cannot be changed. Recommended for most multiplayer games where every player has already played several times.
The game goes 50% faster and cannot be changed.
The game speed can be changed by the host, exactly like in a solo game.
Change the way players can pause the game.
There is no way to pause the game.
Every player can pause the game. After ::value(Game_Pause_Multi_Cancel_Time):: seconds, any player can remove the pause. There is a limitation on how often a single player can pause.
Only the host can pause the game, without any limitation.
Anyone can pause the game without any limitation, but only the player who paused the game can resume it.
Change how challenging you want your Conquest to be.
The Easy AI has no military or economic advantage. It will develop slower and be gentle with the player. It's the perfect difficulty for discovering the game at your own pace.
The Medium AI has no military or economic advantage. It can develop at a normal rate, and will treat the player as any other faction.
The Hard AI has small bonuses to most of its productions and military units, to give it an edge. It will also see the player as more threatening than other factions, and act in consequence.
The Insane AI has a boosted economy and its military units are stronger. It will play for the win and try to crush the player at any opportunity.
